message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about neural relation extraction (NRE), which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel adversarial training mechanism for denoising distant supervision, which involves training a discriminator to distinguish between informative and noisy instances. This approach involves using techniques from machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.AI a likely sub-category as well. The paper also discusses the efficiency and flexibility of the proposed method, which are topics that fall under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on a large-scale benchmark dataset in relation extraction, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques and falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
